alert.note: Alert for Isle of Wight; Southampton; Suffolk (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 09 at 12:47PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...Showers and thunderstorms will impact portions of Isle of Wight, and northeastern Southampton Counties and the central City of Suffolk through 130 PM EDT... At 1246 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Fort Eustis to near Isle Of Wight to near Ivor. Movement was southeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph. Rain of 1 to 2 inches. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Possible flooding of low lying areas. Locations impacted include... Smithfield, Windsor, Holland, Suffolk, Isle Of Wight, Ivor, Rescue, Driver, Carrsville, Crittenden, Kings Fork, Zuni, Carrollton, Longview, Benns Church, Huntersville, Bethel Church, Chuckatuck, Wilroy and Kilby. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
